note: Entity Schema Definitions for Base44 Admin Dashboard

needed: ClientProfile - Customer discovery questionnaire answers (RENAMED from CustomerProfile)
DealerProfile - Sales rep information (OPTIONAL - using auth.me() currently)

entities.name: ClientProfile
entities.description: Stores customer discovery questionnaire answers collected during the intro process. This data is passed to the AI for personalized booth design generation.

fields.name: dealer_id
fields.description: ID of the dealer who created this client profile

fields.name: dealer_email
fields.description: Email of the dealer (for filtering/lookup)

fields.name: objectives
fields.description: Array of client's primary trade show objectives

fields.name: needs_multiple_sizes
fields.description: Whether client needs to see options for multiple booth sizes

fields.name: display_products
fields.description: Whether client needs to physically display products at the booth

fields.name: needs_demo_space
fields.description: Whether client needs space for product demonstrations or presentations

fields.name: needs_conference_area
fields.description: Whether client needs a private conference/meeting area in the booth

fields.name: needs_graphic_design
fields.description: Whether client needs custom graphic design services

fields.name: desired_look
fields.description: Array of desired visual aesthetics from customer

fields.name: desired_feel
fields.description: Array of desired experiential qualities

fields.name: needs_logistics
fields.description: Whether client needs full logistics support (shipping, setup, teardown)

fields.name: additional_notes
fields.description: Any additional requirements, preferences, or special requests from client

fields.name: booth_size
fields.description: Primary booth size requested

fields.name: show_date
fields.description: Date of the trade show (YYYY-MM-DD format)

fields.name: website_url
fields.description: Client's website URL for AI brand analysis

fields.name: show_name
fields.description: Name of the trade show event (optional)

entities.name: DealerProfile
entities.description: OPTIONAL - Sales rep/dealer profile. Currently using base44.auth.me() which has: company_name, contact_name, phone, email. Only create this if you want separate dealer profile management.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: Reference to the authenticated user ID

fields.name: email
fields.description: Dealer's email address

fields.name: company_name
fields.description: Dealer's company name

fields.name: contact_name
fields.description: Dealer's full name

fields.name: phone
fields.description: Dealer's phone number

fields.name: is_active
fields.description: Whether the dealer account is active

setup_instructions: 1. Go to https://app.base44.com and log in with your credentials
2. Navigate to your app: App ID 69834d9e0d7220d671bfd124
3. Click on 'Database' or 'Schema' section in the left sidebar
5. Create the 'ClientProfile' entity using the field definitions above
- Set the field name exactly as shown
- Select the correct field type (text, json, boolean, etc.)
8. (Optional) Create DealerProfile if you want separate dealer management
9. Test by running the app: npm run dev
code_changes_made: ✅ Updated CustomerProfile.jsx line 88: Changed base44.entities.CustomerProfile to base44.entities.ClientProfile
✅ Created this schema definition file for reference
✅ Code already passes all ClientProfile data to AI prompts in Loading.jsx
